resources.string: anDGS è una applicazione client per giocare a Go (Igo, Weiqi, Baduk) sul sito web DragonGoServer.net e per modificare file di partite salvati in locale. In ogni sezione è possibile consultare una pagina di aiuto accessibile tramite il pulsante "menu" di Android.
Inserisci il tuo nome utente DGS e la password, quindi imposta eventuali altre preferenze.
Salva il File SGF con nome:
Inserisci il file da salvare in formato SGF
Imposta il Nome del giocatore Bianco
Imposta il Nome del giocatore Nero
Vuoi usare il file precedente o creare un file nuovo?
Salva, Modifica e poi Salva, o Annulla
Sono presenti modifiche non ancora salvate
Vuoi riprendere la partita dalla posizione che non avevi salvato o continuare con la nuova posizione?
Salvataggio del file di recupero fallito
Il File di recupero non è stato cancellato
Shegli il simbolo per evidenziare questo nodo.
Non ci sono file nella directory
avete passato 2 volte, ora usa il browser per il punteggio
Seleziona una Directory o un File:
Seleziona o scrivi il nome di una Directory
Usa il browser per impostare l\'Handicap
Il tutorial per iparare a giocare a Go che è sul sito web PlayGo.to richiede il flash player. \n Vuoi passare al browser?
Nessun messaggio in attesa né partite
Inserisci o modifica il tuo commento
Invita un altro giocatore a fare una partita
Scarica, Invita o Scrivi un Messaggio
Trova un utente per UserId o Nome utente
Invia un messaggio a un utente
Ci sono altri rami che verranno perso, continuare?
Edit, Visulizza il menu in alto
Play, Visualizza il menu in alto
Le mosse previsti non si trovano
Unsupported game action, user browser to resolve

Client DGS - accedi a DGS sul sito web DragonGoServer.net e gioca o scarica delle partite. 
 
 File di partite salvate - apri per visualizzare e modificare da un elenco di partite salvate in locale. 
 
 Nuova partita - crea una nuova partita in locale. 
 
 Rivedi partite - ripercorri le fasi delle partite registrate (un singolo file o una directory di file), e a scelta riproduci le mosse in modo automatico, oppure cerca di indovinare la mossa successiva. 
 
 Recupera partita - da usare quando una partita in locale ha delle modifiche non salvate. 
 
 Preferenze - (menu Android) imposta il nome dell'utente DGS e la password, così come altri parametri e preferenze. 
 
 Avvio/Arresto delle Notifiche - (menu Android) avvia o arresta il servizio di notifica DGS. 
 
 Tutorial - (menu Android) Iniziare a giocare da principiante. Collegamento a PlayGo.to che richiede l'installazione di flash player 
 
 Apri/Scarica - (Esterno) Aprendo un file SGF in un visualizzatore di file esterno si aprirà nell'editor delle partite. Un link a un file SGF nel browser web verrà scaricato dal browser e da lì potrai aprirlo nell'editor delle partite, proprio come gli altri file SGF, o altrimenti si aprirà direttamente nell'editor, a seconda del browser e della configurazione del sito web.

Imposta i parametri e le preferenze per anDGS, usa il bottone Salva per salvare le modifiche o il bottone standard indietro per ignorare le modifiche. 
 
 Utente e Password - credenziali per accedere a DragonGoServer.net. 
 
 Client automatico - abilita DGS Client ad autenticarsi automaticamente e percorrere in sequenza le partite in attesa di una mossa. 
 
 Auto Start Notifier - enable DGS App to automatically start the notifier. This helps to process predicted move sequences. 
 
 Mantieni acceso lo schermo - Mantiene acceso lo schermo quando una partita viene visualizzata. 
 
 Seleziona il Layout - Seleziona il layout dello schermo. Opzioni: 
 - verticale 
 - orizzontale 
 
 Controllo Mossa - Controlla il modo di fare le mosse. Opzioni: 
 - 7x7 zoom 
 - 9x9 zoom 
 - 11x11 zoom 
 - 13x13 zoom 
 - D-Pad (key pad direzionale) 
 - One touch 
 
 Seleziona il Tema - Seleziona il tema di colori per la app. 
 
 Lingua - Seleziona la Lingua usata per la app. 
 
 Coordinate - Controlla se visualizzare le coordinate ai bordi del goban. 
 
 Sfondo del Goban - Imposta lo sfondo del Goban. Opzioni: 
 - colore "Bianco" 
 - colore "Semplice" 
 - tessitura "Legno" 
 - colori a scelta dell'utente "Personalizzato" 
 
 Spessore Linea - Regola lo spessore della linea sul goban. 1.0 è il valore predefinito, 2.0 è il doppio, 0.5 la metà. 
 
 Pietra - Imposta il tipo di pietra. Opzioni: 
 - "Monocromaico", semplice bianco e nero 
 - "Conchiglia", tessitura in ardesia e conchiglia 
 
 Modalità di Edit Predefinita - Controlla la modalità iniziale di edit per le partite quando si accede dalla vista delle Partite Salvate. 
 
 Ordinamento dell'elenco delle partite - Consente di orinare le partite nell'elenco che determina la sequenza in cui sono presentate dal Client automaticamente per fare le mosse. 
 - Pagina di Stato - l'ordinamento è quello della pagina di stato come viene visualizzata nel browser. 
 - Nessun Ordinamento - è l'accesso più efficiente al database, l'ordinamento non è prevedibile. 
 - Ultima mossa - ordinate in base al tempo in cui l'avversario ha giocato l'ultima mossa. 
 - Numero di mosse - ordinate in base al numero di mosse della partita. 
 - Priorità - ordinate in base alla priorità definita dall'utente. 
 - Tempo rimasto - ordinate in base al tempo rimasto per la partita. 
 
 Skip moves count - In the editor, set the number moves to skip forward/backward for a short press of the FF/Rew buttons. Minimum is 2. 
 
 Edit/Play, number previous moves count - In the editor or DGS player, set the number of previous moves that will be labeled. Values are -9 through 99. 0 is for no numbering. For negative values, the numbering starts with -1 at the previous move and continues down for the specified number of moves. For positive values, the numbering starts with the specified number (or the number of previous moves if that is less that the specified number) at the previous move and continues down until the value 1. Numbering will stop on any stone label, pass, ko or the beginning of the game. 
 
 Game Notes - enables the display of game notes in the active games on DGS when you move. 
 
 Notifier Sound - enable sound on notification event. Options: 
 - none 
 - default 
 - stone 
 
 Notifier Interval - the initial number of seconds delay polling DGS for games and messages. The minimum set able value is 30 seconds, but the server will start sending stale information if the value is 60 seconds or below. 120 seconds is a good balance point. The notifier uses a back off algorithm up to about 15 minutes to cut the load on the server during periods where you have no activity. Settings greater than 15 minutes will remain constant. 
 
 Notifier Vibrate - enable/disable notification with vibrate. 
 
 Notify Failure - enable/disable notification of a communication failure response in the notifier. 
 
 Auto Play Interval - the number of seconds between moves in auto play or grinder mode. 
 
 Auto Play Pause - pause auto play when starting a game in auto play mode or entering auto play mode in a game. 
 
 Auto Play Sound - play a sound in auto play mode when a move is placed on the board. 
 
 Default SGF Directory - the default directory where SGF files are saved and where you start when looking for an SGF file to open. A simple name (ex: sgfs) will be the directory in the system default directory. A value starting with a "/" allows you to specifiy the entire path from the system root directory. 
 
 Server URL - the URL for the DGS server. Useful to connect to the development server or your own private DGS implementation.

Skip - to not play in this game and go to the next game. 
 
 Skip All - skip the remaining games and return to the main view (same as the Back button.) 
 
 Undo - remove the selected move to try again. 
 
 Submit - send the move to the server. 
 
 In zoom mode, Touch the board to zoom to that area, touch again to make a move. 
 In dpad mode, Touch the board to select that area, use the directional pad to refine the location and select the position. 
 In one touch mode, Touch once to make a move. 
 
 <> - to go back to the large board to select another area. 
 
 Comments will appear below the control buttons. After making a move you may create or edit a return comment by touching the comment button. The Undo button will also undo the comment. 
 
 If the Game Notes preference is enabled, Game note will be displayed between the Comments and the control buttons. Touch the Game Note to see the full note and to edit it. 
 
 From the menu (top or Android), you may make a pass, resign, score or delete a game. Also, you may download the current game to the local editor. 
 
 Predicted Moves - You may play ahead for a single sequence of moves, no branching. Selecting the last move in the predicted sequence will delete it. Undo will start over at the last real opponent move. Running the notifier will allow these predicted moves to be played in the background. Otherwise, "Check for moves" will play any correct predicted moves before opening the board for manual moves. An incorrect predicted opponent move will clear the predicted moves for that game. Playing in a game via the Status list will clear the predicted moves for that game. A comment is only allowed on the first move of a predicted sequence. A comment from the opponent will interrupt the predicted sequence.

Touch the game name to open or select the game. 
 Touch the directory name to enter or select the directory. 
 The dot entries are special values: 
 "." - refresh the current directory values. 
 ".." - go up one directory level to the parent of the current directory.

Game sizes may be 5x5, through 25x25 
 
 Handicap may be 0-9 on odd sizes 11x11 or larger; 0-5 on 9x9 and 0-4 on 7x7. All other sizes have handicap of 0.
 There is a Free Placement check box that will allow manual entry of the number of stones selected at the beginning of the game. 
 
 Komi may be -9.5 - 10.5, (including whole number komi values) 
 
 Black and White player names may be set. 
 
 A .sgf will be automatically added to the game name. The file will be stored in the default directory on the external storage of the device.

The following buttons appear below the board. 
 << - short touch - skip n moves, long touch - go to the beginning. 
 < - short touch: go to the previous move. touch and hold: step through previous moves at Auto Play Interval rate.
 > - short touch: go to the next move. touch and hold: step through next moves at Auto Play Interval rate.
 >> - short touch - skip n moves, long touch - go to the last move on the main branch or start/stop auto play. 
 V - go to the next variation of this move. 
 A - go to the previous variation of this move. 
 
 Below the board control buttons is a comment button, which may be used to enter or edit a comment. 
 
 The menu buttons (top and Android) support a number of off board functions: 
 - End Game - Pass, Resign, Score 
 - Game Info - extra information contained in the game record. 
 - Save - save the game record to external storage. 
 - .modes. - display the current mode and change the mode. 
 - ? - this help page. 
 The Android menu has an options button to change various Preferences just for this game. 
 
 In edit mode: To add a move at the end of the game or variation, select an empty point. 
 To delete a move at the end of the game or variation, select the current move. 
 At any move, not at the end of the game, selecting an empty intersection on the board will popup a menu to: 
 - Create a variation at the selected intersection. 
 - Replace one move; Move the current move to a new empty spot. 
 - Replace all moves; Move the current move to a new empty spot and delete the rest of the branch. 
 - Delete current move.\ - Insert Black Move after current move at the selected intersection. 
 - Insert White move after current move at the selected intersection. 
 The pass button in the menu will allow you to add or remove pass moves or replace a regular move with a pass move. /n 
 In browse mode: 
 Selecting a stone or the pass menu button will move to the first occurrence of that move in the game. 
 With move control zoom, the left, right, up, down directional keys can be used to move through the games tree and the center keypad key will open a comment window. 
 
 In auto play mode: 
 The long press >> button is used to stop and start auto play. The other buttons will still function as normal. 
 X - stop auto play. 
 O - start auto play. 
 
 In guess move mode: 
 The >> button is used to exit such that the Review Games will select the next game. The other buttons will still function as normal. 
 # - return to continue with next game. 
 The "back" key will return without continuing. 
 
 Move control - zoom: 
 Touching the board will zoom to that area to make a move. 
 <> - will unzoom a zoomed board. 
 Board sizes less than or equal to the zoom size will use the one touch mode. 
 
 Move control - dpad: 
 Touching the board will focus on a position in that area. The directional key pad may be used to refine the focused position and the center button will select to make a move. 
 
 Move control - one touch: 
 Touching the board will make a move at that location. 
 
 Mode and auto play options may be set via the editor menu.

You may download any game on DGS to the game editor and use all the features of the game editor. 
 
 The game number of the DGS game is a required parameters. 
 Saving will be done to a file named game.sgf which may be changed if it already exists.

Set game options: 
 Changes to these options only apply to the current game. 
 Mode: 
 - auto play: to automatically step through the game. 
 - browse: to go to the move at the selected board position. 
 - edit: to place moves and variations on the board. 
 - guess move: to guess the next move in the game, can be any next variation or pass. 
 - markup: to edit the marked and labeled positions on this node. 
 
 Skip moves count - In the editor, set the number moves to skip forward/backward for a short press of the FF/Rew buttons. Minimum is 2. 
 
 Edit/Play, number previous moves count - In the editor or DGS player, set the number of previous moves that will be labeled with a decreasing number starting at -1. Maximum number of moves is 9. Numbering will stop on any pass or ko. 
 
 Auto Play Interval - the number of seconds between moves in auto play mode. 
 
 Auto Play Pause - pause auto play when entering auto play mode in this game.

Review games will sequence through all the games in a directory or only a single game using the selected mode. 
 
 You may type in a path to a directory or file; or you may use the file browser to browse the external storage for a file or directory. 
 The app will cycle through the files and repeating the list until the cycle is escaped with the "back" key. 
 
 Mode: 
 - auto play: to automatically step through the game. 
 - browse: to go to the move at the selected board position. 
 - edit: to place moves and variations on the board. 
 - guess move: to guess the next move in the game, can be any next variation or pass. 
 
 Auto Play Interval - the number of seconds between moves in auto play mode. 
 Auto Play Pause - pause auto play when starting each game in auto play mode. 
 Start - to start at the beginning of the selected files. 
 Continue - to continue with the next file, if you escaped from the game with the "back" key.

Set or remove a mark, add or remove a stone and/or add or remove a label at a position on the board. 
 Selecting "None" will clear both the mark and the add stone options. Labels can be set or cleared independently of marks and stones. Marks and stones may be set independently. 
 Marks are the standard sgf properties of mark (X), triangle, circle, square, white territory and black territory. 
 Add empty, add black and add white interact to control the stone displayed. There are typically used to create diagrams or problems. 
 A label may be any string of upper or lower case letters or numbers, but only the first two characters are displayed.

Main screen for interaction with the DGS Server. 
 
 Check For Moves - Display waiting games and messages one at a time for user action. Initiating a new game on DGS or negotiating a new game settings must be done via the normal browser interface. All other game functions are supported by anDGS. 
 
 Status - See all your waiting games and messages and select them individually. 
 
 Running Games - See one page of your running games. The number of games is controlled by your DGS setting for that page. Touch a game to download to the local games editor. 
 
 Team Games - See one page of your games with more than 2 players. Same features as Running Games. 
 
 Finished Games - See one page of your Finished games. Same features as Running Games. 
 
 Observed Games - See one page of your Observed games. Same features as Running Games. 
 
 Waiting Room - See Waiting Room game offers that you may join. 
 
 User Info - See a user's info. 
 
 Invite User - Currently takes you to the server invitation page in a browser. 
 
 Message User - Send a message to another user. Must know the user's userid. 
 
 Download Game - download any DGS game to the local editor via the gameid. 
 
 Predicted Moves - The list of games where you have played ahead of the current move. Touch an entry to delete it. 
 
 You may play ahead for a single sequence of moves, no branching. Selecting the last move in the predicted sequence will delete it. Undo will start over at the last real opponent move. Running the notifier will allow these predicted moves to be played in the background. Otherwise, "Check for moves" will play any correct predicted moves before opening the board for manual moves. An incorrect predicted opponent move will clear the predicted moves for that game. Playing in a game via the Status list will clear the predicted moves for that game. A comment is only allowed on the first move of a predicted sequence. A comment from the opponent will interrupt the predicted sequence. 
 
 Start/Stop Notifier - (Android menu) start or stop the DGS Notifier service.

Displays waiting games and messages from the DGS Server. 
 
 You may select a game from the list to make a move, or select a message to see the message text.

Displaying your running, team, finished or observed games. 
 
 Only one page of information is displayed. You may change the number of games displayed by changing the options in your profile for game lists on the DGS server. 
 You may select a game from the list to download to the local editor. 
 
 
 Or displays available Waiting Room games which you my select to join.

Displays a message from the DGS Server. 
 
 Skip All - When "Checking for Moves", escape to the DGS Client main view. Otherwise, it is the same as Done. 
 
 Done - Finish looking at this message and continue. 
 
 Reply - Send a reply to the other user and continue. 
 
 Use Browser - open a message in the browser to allow better formatting and using links on the page.

Send a message to a User. 
 
 Submit - Send this message and continue.

Invite another user to a game. 
 
 Submit - Send this invite.

Display the rating graph for a user. 
 
 Submit - Get the graph in a browser.

Display list of users in the prowser. 
 
 Submit - Get the user list in a browser.

Create or use predefined Phrases. 
 
 Click on a phrase or the "." entry to optionally modify and use the phrase in a comment. A phrase may not contain a newline character, thus must be a single line.

The User and Password preferences must be set to use the DGS Client. 
 
 If you do not have a DGS User/Password, please use a browser to go to DragonGoServer.net and register a free account.
Visualizza Pronostici Moves. Formato: \n GameID! timeStamp! si muove ... \n
Displays the last 20 communication errors or failures \n

Credits: 
 Developer: Michael Dobbins 
 Chinese Translation: 安卓网汉化 www.hiapk.com 
 German Translation: Jonas Sorgalla, Christian auf der Horst 
 Italian Translation: Emanuele Cisbani 
 Korean Translation: Kyoungnam Ahn 
 Russian Translation: Sergy Volkov, Damir Sultanbekov

Per poter salvare informazioni sull\'app come file di gioco, mosse previste, frasi di commento e cronologia degli errori, dovrai attivare l\'autorizzazione di archiviazione dei file nelle impostazioni dell\'app.
